i18n.key: Form title, displayed on the website
Form description, may be used as the form help text. Displayed on the website as the form header.
Submit button label (text displayed on the button at the bottom of the form. Ideally, "Send" or "Submit" is used).
select the template you wish to apply to the form. The template based on bullet lists is recommended for accessibility reasons.
This adds a to link to return to the page visited before coming to this form. This can come in handy when using a form from another module.

A CAPTCHA (Completely Automated Public Turing test to Tell Computers and Humans Apart) is a system allowing to ensure that the form is posted by a human (and not a robot) in order to avoid spam. CAPTCHAs generated by RBS Change only contain figures. Warning: using a graphical CAPTCHA goes against accessibility rules.
Warning: using a graphical CAPTCHA goes against accessibility rules.
Text displayed at the bottom of the form, mainly used to show legal information about the collected data.
Confirmation message that is displayed instead of the form after a successful submission. You may use user submitted data with the following syntax: {fieldName}.
Check "yes" to send a return receipt during form submission. For the email to be sent, the form must contain an email type field with the "return receipt recipient" option checked.
Check "yes" to save the responses to the form.
